subject: Re: [junit] Ignore without recompile?
msgSnippet: I m not going to get into a big discussion of the merits of TestNG on the JUnit list... so you ll just need to do some research into that on your own, or pose
messageBody:
I'm not going to get into a big discussion of the merits of TestNG on
the JUnit list... so you'll just need to do some research into that on
your own, or pose that question on the TestNG list. My group uses both
tools depending on the project and our specific needs so I honestly
can't tell you to use one vs the other. ;-)

As for Continuum... It comes from the same team working on the Maven
build tool and is a very nice CI server. It is newer than
CruiseControl but there are a number of people using it and working on
it etc and the user list is rather active. They are working on v1.1
with a large number of new features etc so its taking some time.

As you mentioned, CruiseControl and Anthill are two other CI servers.
Most people I know run CruiseControl; I actually don't know anyone
personally who runs Anthill, but that doesn't mean much. I would take
a look at the various CI server mailing lists, current/planned feature
lists, SCM check-ins and bug trackers to get a feel for which one is
the best fit for your team.

Wayne

On 3/8/07, Niklas Saers <niklassaers@...> wrote:
> Thanks guys for your many answers. I have a couple of questions
> regarding your suggestions:
>
> CÃ©deric and Wayne: TestNG: how mature / well used is this compared to
> JUnit? I've been using JUnit in a few projects before and see that
> lots of people use it. I've heared about TestNG before and when
> researching my ignore problems I saw it and thought that its
> different parameters for @Test looked intriguing. Does JUnit do stuff
> that TestNG doesn't that I should know that I'm sacrificing should I
> switch to TestNG?
>
> Continuum 1.0.3 is considered a preview release from its
> documentation and was released a year ago. This tells me that it is
> not stable and well-tried and probably hasn't a big community
> submitting bugs and coming with feature requests. This of course is
> countered by 79 commits last month. :-) What is the state of Continuum?
>
> How do CruiseControl, Continuum and Anthill compare to one-another?
> Thanks Wayne for these pointers, it all looks like a much better deal
> than Cron. :-)
>
> Cheers
>
> Nik
